original: Suspicious Note
string: 可疑的笔记

original:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont" size="14">
Skaal Village is quite far away, and we went to considerable effort to get our agent there. It seems like someone else appreciated the value of the tome you're looking for, perhaps someone closer to you than you think.

As always, the shadows see you.

- D
</font>
string:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont" size="14">
史考村庄很远，我们竭尽全力把我们的特工送到那里。看起来有人欣赏你正在寻找的那本书的价值，也许比你想象的更靠近你的人。

一如既往，暗影总能看见你。

- D
</font>

original: Written Orders
string: 书面命令

original:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont" size="16">
Take two others and keep a watch on the northern path out of Raven Rock. Don't harass or kill any of the townsfolk, but you're free to take out anyone else that wanders by. You are to watch the guards, figure out how often they check the north of town. If any GUARDS come out to see what you're up to, capture them if you can, but kill them if you cannot. Either way, drag them or their body back to our camp at the standing stones - what the Skaal called 'Brodir Grove'. Boethiah blesses you in this endeavor.
</font>
string:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont" size="16">
带上其他两个人，盯着乌鸦岩北部的道路。不要骚扰或杀害任何镇民，但你可以干掉路过的其他人。你要注意卫兵，看看他们多久检查一次城镇北部。如果有卫兵出来看你在做什么，尽量抓住他们，如果不能则杀死他们。无论如何，把他们或他们的尸体拖回我们的营地，在站立的石头附近 -史考人叫做“布罗迪尔林”。波耶西亚在这个努力中保佑你。
</font>

original: Written Orders
string: 书面命令

original:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont" size="16">
Hopefully you should be receiving the occasional guard - alive or dead - and their armor from our scouting parties in the field. Torture the guards for information. We want to know their schedules, rotations, and numbers, collect the armor, and kill them. Deliver the armor and information to me at Kagrumez. Succeed, and Boethiah and I shall be pleased. Fail, and taste the wrath of her Hand. 
</font>
string:
希望你可以不时收到护卫 - 无论是活的还是死的 - 和他们在野外侦查队中的装备。拷打这些卫兵以获取信息。我们想知道他们的时间表、轮班和人数，收集这些装备并杀死他们。将装备和信息交给我在卡谷梅兹处。成功了，波耶西亚和我将感到高兴。失败了，尝尝她之手的愤怒。
 - 朗卢瑟
<font face="$HandwrittenFont" size="16">>

original: Daedric Intervention: Bal Meryan
string: 迪德拉干涉：巴尔莫兰

original: Folded Letter
string: 折叠的信件

original:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont" size="16">
Your associate has been captured attempting to pilfer supplies from our larder. Normally we'd deal with such behavior quite harshly, but she assured us that you have the coin to make her release worth her while.

Bring 1500 gold to the path outside Fort Kastav and leave it in a sack. Do not attempt to enter the fort. Once we have received payment Vendressa will be set free.
</font>
string:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont" size="16">
你的同伴试图从我们的食品库偷东西被捕。通常情况下，我们会对这种行为采取严厉措施，但她向我们保证你能支付足够的金币来让她释放的价值

带1500金币到卡斯塔夫要塞外的路上，并将其放在一个袋子里。不要试图进入要塞。一旦我们收到付款，温德丽莎将被释放。
</font>

original: Elegant Letter
string: 优雅的书信

original:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont" size="16">
= Ardela = 

Of course I saw you slipping that note into my pack. I do notice these things, pretty much every time. Please never stop doing it. You do always cheer me up, sister of mine. You are ferocious, loyal, indomitable, and completely without stealth or guile. I hope to get Vendressa out of that wretched prison at Fort Kastav soon enough, but it'll take me a few days to get there. By the time you read this, I'll likely be about halfway to Dawnstar if the weather holds.

- = Drelyra = -
</font>
string:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont" size="16">
= 阿尔黛拉 = 

当然，我看到你把那张纸条塞进我的包里。我总是会注意到这些事情，几乎每次都这样。请永远不要停止这样做。你总是能让我高兴起来，亲爱的姐妹。你是勇敢的，忠诚的，坚不可摧的，但也绝对没有伪装或花言巧语。我希望会尽快把温德丽莎从那该死的卡斯塔夫堡监狱里解救出来，但我需要几天时间才能到那里。当你读到这个消息时，如果天气不错，我可能已经走到了晨星的半路。

- = 德莉拉 = -
</font>

original: Crumpled Letter
string: 皱巴巴的信

original:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont" size="16">
I guess this is a will of sorts. I'll keep it brief. If you're reading this, I'm dead, and you're digging through my things. Take them, I don't care any more. But if you could take my frozen corpse and stick it outside Nindasu's chambers at the Raven Rock Temple, that'd give her a good fright. Then you'd be able to kill her and dig through her stuff too. Serves the hag right for getting the rest of us killed. She doesn't deserve to be the last survivor.
</font>
string:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont" size="16">
我猜这是一种遗嘱。我会说得很简洁。如果你正在读这个，那就说明我死了，而你正在搜查我的东西。拿走吧，我不再在乎了。但如果你能把我的冰冷尸体放在乌鸦岩神殿妮达苏的房间外，那会让她吓一跳。然后你就可以杀了她，搜查她的物品。把我们其他人都置于死地的老妇应得如此。她不配成为最后的幸存者。
</font>

original: Scrawled Note
string: 手写便条

original:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont" size="16">
Ruvi - 

N'chow. I've been captured again. I don't think they'll let me free. Don't pay the bounty. Also please don't kill the bringer of this note. They're the one person who was kind to me in this wretched prison. I hope the Riften guards and the Thieves Guild let them through.

- Dressa
</font>
string:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont" size="16">
鲁维 - 呢哟。我又被抓住了。我觉得他们不会释放我。不要付赏金。另外，请不要杀死带这封纸条的人。在这个可恶的监狱里，她是唯一对我好的人。我希望裂谷城的卫兵和窃贼行会让她通过。

- 德丽莎
</font>

original: Scribbled Note
string: 涂鸦的便条

original:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont" size="16">
Dela - 

I'm in trouble again. I need you and your big Kagouti arms to get over here from Labyrinthian and bust me out. DON'T pay the bounty. Please don't kill the young man bringing this note to you. Of course, I know you're reading this note, young ser'a. Remember, help me get out of here and you'll be rich.

- Dressa
</font>
string:
<Dela - 我又麻烦了。我需要你和你那双大卡古蒂的手臂从迷城来救我。不要付赏金。请不要杀掉带这张纸条给你的年轻人。当然，我知道你正在读这封纸条，年轻的先生。记住，帮我脱困，你就会发家致富。

- 德丽莎
<font face="$HandwrittenFont" size="16">

original: Folded Letter
string: 折叠的信件

original:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont" size="18">
Drelyra - 

You are my oldest and dearest friend. I love you as a sister. You warm my heart when you are near, and guide my path when I am lost. I slipped this note in your pack last night while you slept, to cheer you up on your trip. I'll be waiting for you back at our meet spot at Labyrinthian.

- Ardela
</font>
string:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont" size="18">
德莉拉 - 

你是我最老、最亲近的朋友。我像姐妹一样爱你。你靠近时，我的心会温暖，当我迷失时，你会指引我的道路。昨晚趁你睡觉时，我将这张便条放在你的背包里，为了让你旅程更加快乐。我会在迷城我们的见面点等你。

- 阿尔黛拉拉
</font>

original: Terse Letter
string: 简短的信

original:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont" size="16">
Sister Ruveni - 

I expect you to maintain your position in Riften for another three weeks, just in case any survivors make their way to the meeting point. I know not where Drelyra pranced off to, nor do I care. She's probably dead by now. When your watch is done, make your way to Raven Rock. I'll be at the Temple. If I have any luck at all, the Prelate there will allow us to re-establish our Order in Solstheim.

- Nindasu, Hand of Mephala
</font>
string:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont" size="16">
鲁文妮修女 - 我希望你能保持在裂谷城的职位再三周，以防有幸存者前往约会地点。我不知道德莉拉去哪里了，也不在乎。她现在可能已经死了。当你的警戒结束时，前往乌鸦岩吧。我会在神殿里等你。如果我有好运气的话，那里的首领会允许我们在索瑟海姆重新建立我们的秩序。

- 梅法拉之手 妮达苏
</font>

original: Succinct Letter
string: 简明的信件

original:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont" size="16">
Mother Nindasu, Hand of Mephala - 

I shall do as you command. Thus far, only one survivor returned, Sister Vendressa. I sent her out searching for Mother Drelyra, but will recall her immediately. I look forward to leaving this den of thieves here at Riften. They live in a sewer. A sewer! Raven Rock sounds far more pleasant.

- Ruveni, Sister of the Ashen Veil
</font>
string: <font face="$HandwrittenFont" size="16">妮达苏之母，梅法拉之手- 我会照你的命令行事。迄今只有一个幸存者回来，修女温德丽莎。我派她出去找德雷丽拉之母，但会立即召回她。我期待着离开这个来自裂谷城的窃贼巢穴。他们住在下水道里。渡鸦矿场听起来要愉快得多。-灰纱之序修女鲁文妮</font>

original: Frostbitten Letter
string: 霜冻信件

original:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont" size="14">
I went to Saering's Watch in the far north of Solstheim just as you requested but I think it might be the wrong temple. There's no Daedric influence here, just piles of Draugr. This complicates things, of course, but I shall continue to investigate, perhaps there is more to this place than initial appearances suggest.

Technically, I promised the bearer of this note thirty gold coins upon delivery, but knowing you, there's probably a dead reaver at your feet instead.

- Selvoneth
</font>
string:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont" size="14">
我按照你的要求去了索瑟海姆北端的瑟琳看台，但我觉得那可能不是正确的神庙。这里没有追随迪德拉的影响，只有大把的幽灵。这当然让事情复杂化，但我会继续调查，也许这个地方比起初表面显示的更复杂。

从技术层面上，我承诺给这封信的携带者三十枚金币作为交付时的酬劳，但我知道你，你可能脚下有个死去的劫掠者。

- 赛尔沃内斯
</font>

original: Suspicious Note
string: 可疑的笔记

original:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont" size="14">
I got word that the tome you're looking for has been taken by an agent of Master Neloth, and should be found in Tel Mithryn. As it is a very captivating tome, I am certain that Neloth has begun reading it already, and will likely stash it under his bed just like Councillor Morvayn did. Remember, this job is important, and we're watching you.

- D
</font>
string:
我听说你正在寻找的卷轴已经被尼洛斯大师的特工拿走了，应该在泰尔密辛临被找到。因为这是一本非常引人入胜的卷轴，我相信尼洛斯已经开始阅读它了，很可能会像莫尔凡议员一样把它藏在床底下。记住，这个任务很重要，我们会关注你的。
 - D
<font face="$HandwrittenFont" size="14">>

original: Suspicious Note
string: 可疑的笔记

original:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont" size="14">
It was very difficult to get someone into Tel Mithryn to leave you this note, but we have our ways. Master Neloth is well known as a strange and mercurial fellow, and it seems like he was not pleased with the tome, which he traded to Fanari Strong-Voice at Skaal Village. She appreciates the value of this tome more than Neloth, and is keeping it under her bed.

Remember. We're watching you.

- D
</font>
string:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont" size="14">
很难悄悄让有人到泰尔密辛临给你留张便条，但我们有办法。尼洛施大师因奇怪和多变而出了名，他似乎对这本书不满意，将其交易到斯卡尔村的法纳莉·坚声手中。她比尼洛施更欣赏这本书的价值，并将其放在床底下。

记住，我们在看着你。

- D
</font>

original: Of course. What's your name, may I ask?
string: 当然。请问你叫什么名字？

original: I'm Drelyra. Drelyra Uvirith, of the Order of the Ashen Veil. Those Vigilants nearly had me. Next time I might not be so lucky.
string: 我是德莉拉。德莉拉·乌维里斯，灰纱修会的成员。那些警戒者几乎抓住了我。下次我可能就不那么幸运了。

original: That was... a lot of Draugr.
string: 那是…很多死灵。

original: And I'm a lot capable myself. I didn't need you.
string: 而我自己也很有能力。我不需要你。

original: Do you want out of here?
string: 你想离开这里吗？

original: No thank you. I'll just stay and wait around uselessly. ... Of course I want out of here.
string: 不用了，谢谢。我只是待在这里无所事事。...当然我想离开这里。

original: You don't look like a member of the Thieves Guild.
string: 你看起来不像盗贼行会的成员。

original: I suppose I should take that as a compliment. Why are you speaking with me, ser'a?
string: 我想我应该把这看作是一种赞美。你为什么要和我说话，阁下？

original: Bad spot to get cornered by a pack of trolls.
string: 被一群巨魔围困的糟糕地点。

original: I could claim to have been able to handle them, but truth is I needed the help.
string: 我可以声称我能够处理他们，但事实上我需要帮助。

original: It seems like something is bothering you.
string: 看起来你很烦恼。

original: Is it that obvious? I generally keep my emotions veiled. Mephala will be disappointed.
string: 是那么明显吗？我通常会隐藏我的情感。麦芙拉会失望的。

original: I'm glad you're all right. Is there any way I can help?
string: 很高兴你平安无事。有什么我能帮忙的吗？

original: You seem capable. You certainly dealt with those Vigilants easily enough. Yes, I could indeed use your help with the rest of them.
string: 你看起来很能干。你轻而易举地对付了那些警戒者。是的，我确实需要你帮忙处理其他人。

original: Thanks. I wouldn't mind 'dealing' with more of those Vigilants.
string: 谢谢。我不介意再“解决”更多那些警戒者。

original: We need to find my sisters. Well, one is an actual sister. The others are fellow nuns. If we don't head out now, I'll stay here a bit to recuperate.
string: 我们需要找到我的姐妹。其中一位是真正的姐妹，其他人是同修女。如果我们现在不出发，我会在这里留下一段时间休养。

original: I'm glad you're all right. Stay safe.
string: 很高兴你没事。保重。

original: You as well, ser'a.
string: 你也是，ser'a。

original: I like to know who I kill. Time to claim your treasures!
string: 我想知道我杀的是谁。是时候要夺取你的财宝了！

original: We shall see who dies, fetcher!
string: 我们看谁死，混蛋！

original: Thanks, but I'd rather not make an enemy of the Vigil of Stendarr.
string: 谢谢，但我宁愿不招惹斯坦达尔的敌人。

original: Understood. We shall speak no more of this.
string: 明白了。我们将不再谈论此事。

original: Tell me about yourself.
string: 告诉我关于你自己的事情。

original: What would you like to know?
string: 你想知道什么？

original: Ask away, ser'a.
string: 尽管问吧，少爷。

original: Perhaps.
string: 也许吧。

original: I will gladly talk to you, about anything you like!
string: 我乐意和你交谈，任何你想谈的！

original: As you have my favor, I shall suffer your questions.
string: 既然你得到了我的青睐，我会回答你的问题。

original: Sure. Well, what do you want to speak about?
string: 当然。那么，你想谈些什么？

original: Tell me about your family.
string: 告诉我关于你家人的事情。

original: I'd prefer not to talk about it.
string: 我宁愿不谈这个。

original: Perhaps another time.
string: 也许下次吧。

original: There are some things better left unsaid.
string: 有些事最好不要说出口。

original: I have Selvoneth. She's enough.
string: 我有赛尔沃内斯。她足够了。

original: Maybe we should leave this discussion for another day.
string: 也许我们应该把这个讨论留到另一天。

original: I. ... I'm sorry. Let's discuss something else please.
string: 我……我很抱歉。我们讨论其他事情吧。

original: How about, I don't tell you about my family.
string: 怎么样，我就不和你谈起我的家人了。

original: Let me ponder this question. ... No.
string: 让我考虑一下这个问题。……不行。

original: I suppose I have Drelyra. She's a bit of a bore, but she is my sister.
string: 我想我有德莉拉。她有点无聊，但她是我的姐妹。

original: I'm halfway through conjuring up an ice spike as a pointed response to this query.
string: 我正在准备咒语，要冰尖对付这个提问。

original: Growing up on the streets means your friends are your family.
string: 在街头长大意味着你的朋友就是你的家人。

original: Selvoneth and Drelyra are as close as blood to me. I'd do anything for them.
string: 赛尔沃内斯和德莉拉对我来说像血亲一样重要。为她们我愿意做任何事。

original: My parents were farmers. I suppose they still are. How dull.
string: 我的父母是农民。我想他们现在依然是。多么乏味。

original: Does Red Mountain have glaciers?
string: 红山有冰川吗？

original: I have a brother. He digs around in the dirt, calls it honest work.
string: 我还有一个弟弟。他在泥土里挖掘，说这是诚实的工作。

original: Never knew my parents. They died when I was young. The Uvirith family took me in.
string: 我从小就没见过我的父母。他们在我还很小的时候去世了。乌维里斯家族收留了我。

original: My parents sold me off to the Monastery when I was barely of age. Fools.
string: 我的父母在我年幼时把我卖给修道院。愚蠢。

original: I'd be an Uvirith by name if politics didn't mean they weren't adopting.
string: 如果政治不意味着他们不会收养，我本该是一个乌维瑞斯。

original: I haven't thought about them in some time. I bet they're still digging their plots just outside Mournhold's gates.
string: 我已经有些时间没有考虑过他们。我敢打赌他们仍在莫德霍尔城门外挖掘他们的坟地。

original: As I exist, you can assume I at one point had a mother. Or not, Divayth Fyr and all that.
string: 我存在的时候，你可以假设我曾经有一个母亲。或者没有，迪维斯·费尔之类的。

original: I suppose technically I am indeed married. But she's a Dreugh and I can hardly remember that night with Sam.
string: 我想在技术上我确实是已婚的。但她是海怪，我几乎忘记了那晚上和萨姆的事。

original: If House Telvanni ever falls, House Uvirith might be the ones to bet on.
string: 如果特尔瓦尼家族灭亡，乌维里斯家族可能会是赌注的人选。

original: If you ever meet a quite friendly Dreugh named Shelliah please leave her be.
string: 如果你遇到一个名叫谢利亚的相当友善的水手，请不要打扰她。

original: Everyone in the Order is my sister. They're my family.
string: 组织中的每个人都是我的姐妹。她们是我的家人。

original: My first friend was my great great uncle Yeldu. He was a skeleton. I was five.
string: 我的第一个朋友是我的曾曾叔叔耶尔度。他是个骷髅。我五岁。

original: I don't think so.
string: 我想不是。

original: It's a rare thing for a Dunmer, having a score of creche mates you can call siblings.
string: 对于一位丹莫来说，拥有一个可以称之为兄弟姐妹的孵化器伙伴是一件稀有的事情。

original: I had a cousin who drowned in his bathtub. You remind me of him.
string: 我有一个表哥在浴缸里淹死了。你让我想起了他。

original: I havn't been home to see them in a while. I miss them.
string: 我一段时间没回家看他们了。我想念他们。

original: I'd rather not.
string: 我宁愿不要。

original: The monks I grew up with all meet back up once a year, returning from their stations. I try and make it as well.
string: 我和一年干了一次的僧侣们都会相聚，从他们的岗位返回。我也会努力赶到。

original: Another time.
string: 改日再说。

original: Curate Bevelyu took a special liking to me, basically raised me. Wonderful old codger.
string: 编目官贝吉鲁对我很特别，基本上是把我养大的。真是个了不起的老家伙。

original: All sisters of our Order are my family.
string: 我们灰纱修会所有的姐妹都是我的家人。

original: The Tribunal Temple is my family. I was raised in the Great Fane.
string: 大法官神殿是我的家。我是在伟大神殿中长大的。

original: No.
string: 不。

original: Do you have any stories about where you're from?
string: 你有关于你来自哪里的故事吗？

original: Did you know Kagouti can run as fast as a horse? I found that out the hard way.
string: 你知道卡古蒂能跑得跟马一样快吗？我是走了弯路才发现的。

original: My family was from Vvardenfell, but they left long before I was born. I grew up in Silgrad Tower, a bland, sprawling, unremarkable town.
string: 我家是来自瓦登费尔，但他们在我出生前很久就离开了。我在席尔格拉德塔长大，一个普通、散乱、毫不起眼的小镇。

original: I actually somewhat miss Silgrad Tower. Bit of a cesspit but where isn't these days?
string: 我其实有点怀念银色塔。有点像粪坑，但现在哪里不是呢？

original: I left Silgrad Tower behind years ago. I consider the Fortress-Monastery to be my home.
string: 多年前我离开了封镇塔。我认为要塞修道院是我的家。

original: Once, Ruvi made a bet I couldn't chop off a guar's head with one blow. Turns out that guar belonged to the merchant who was creeping on her. Good tim
string: 曾经，鲁维打赌说我没法一刀砍掉一个瓜尔的头。结果那只瓜尔是一个偷看她的商贩的。好时光。

original: Once, when the ash blew strong for months on end, not even the yams could grow.
string: 曾经，当灰尘连续刮了几个月，甚至山药都无法生长。

original: Didn't grow up in a fancy Tower, but didn't grow up starving either. At least not more than most.
string: 我不是在时髦的塔楼中长大的，但也不是在挨饿。至少不比大多数人更挨饿。

original: I was fortunate to grow up in the Tower proper, rather than the slums like Ardela.
string: 我很幸运能在塔楼内长大，而不像阿尔黛拉那样在贫民窟长大。

original: Morrowind will always be home to me, ash and blood included.
string: 晨风将永远是我的家，包括灰烬和鲜血。

original: As wretched as Morrowind is, the prophet Veloth led us there to find our future.
string: 尽管晨风很糟糕，但是先知维洛斯引领我们去那里找到我们的未来。

original: Growing up on the streets gave me quite the education. In blades and bravado mostly.
string: 在街头长大让我接受了相当的教育。主要是关于剑术和豪气。

original: The streets of Morrowind run as red as the sky.
string: 晨风的街道如同天空一样绯红。

original: I once flayed an impertinent novice for thirty six hours for asking too many questions.
string: 我曾经因一个问题问得太多的冒失新手而苛刻地拷问了三十六个小时。

original: Boring. Now I'm going to much more intriguing locales.
string: 无聊。现在我要去更有趣的地方了。

original: Yes.
string: 是的。

original: Morrowind is home, of course. But I'd much rather see the world.
string: 当然，晨风是家园。但我更愿意看看世界。

original: I am the Hand of Mephala, not some simpleton who prattles on.
string: 我是梅法拉之手，不是一些喋喋不休的人。

original: I grew up in Silgrad Towerr. Bit of a decrepit place.
string: 我在辛格拉德塔长大。有点破旧的地方。

original: None for you.
string: 你们谁也别想要。

original: Knowledge is power. Secret power.
string: 知识就是力量。秘密的力量。

original: Prattle on and you'll discover the price of curiousity.
string: 继续唠叨下去，你就会发现好奇心的代价。

original: Red Mountain's ash is usually quite annoying, but when it blots out the sun, you get an extra nice winter.
string: 红山的火山灰通常很烦人，但当它遮蔽了太阳时，你可以享受到更美好的冬季。

original: Have you ever suffered through a childhood of Kwama Eggs and Ash Yams? I thought not.
string: 你曾经经历过青年时期的岩虫卵和灰薯吗？我想不会。

original: Where is anyone 'from', really? I spend time in places but try not to let them define me.
string: 任何人到底是‘从’哪来的呢？我在各处停留，但努力不让它们定义我。

original: Morrowind never truly leaves a Dunmer's heart, no matter how far they travel.
string: 无论多远他们旅行，晨风永远不会完全离开丹莫的心。

original: I don't miss Mournhold much, but neither did I loathe it.
string: 我不太怀念悲伤之地，但我也不讨厌它。

original: The best part about not being part of the Empire? If you're wealthy enough you can buy slaves to cater to you.
string: 不属于帝国最好的一点？如果你足够富裕，你可以购买奴隶来侍奉你。

original: The ash doesn't blow too strongly to the East most of the time, so we got spared the worst of it.
string: 灰尘并不经常向东方吹动，所以我们得以幸免于其影响。

original: When I was young, I survived by picking pockets and cracking locks.
string: 在我年轻的时候，我靠偷窃和开锁谋生。

original: Even under the baleful gaze of Red Mountain, Mournhold endures. You can scoop ash right out of the sky some days.
string: 哪怕是在赤红山的仇恨凝视下，哀伤之城依然存在。有些日子你甚至可以从天空中舀起灰烬。

original: The dead are everywhere back home. You get used to them. Visitors are surprised though.
string: 在家乡，死者无处不在。你会习以为常。不过，来访者却感到惊讶。

original: There's a statue of Saint Almalexia back home, in quite the disrepair. I still pay my respects, however.
string: 家乡有一尊圣阿玛莱西亚的雕像，现在已经相当破旧了。不过我仍然会向她表示敬意。

original: Grew up in the capital. No not that Imperial junktown. Mournhold, the capital of Morrowind.
string: 我在首都长大。不，不是那个帝国的破城。哀伤之城，晨风首都。

original: I grew up in the Temple city of Necrom. Wonderful place, full of enchantment.
string: 我在死灵之城内克罗姆长大。一个美妙的地方，充满了魔力。

original: If you get a chance, you should visit Necrom. The dead don't bother you much and the living are respectful.
string: 如果你有机会，你应该去拜访尼克罗姆。死者不会太困扰你，而且生者都很尊重。

original: I do sometimes miss Necrom, the way the temple towers cluster in silent ziggurats.
string: 我有时确实怀念内克罗姆，寺庙塔楼默默地聚集在阶梯式建筑中的感觉。

original: What's your weapon of choice?
string: 你的选择武器是什么？

original: My spells, obviously. Very obviously.
string: 我的法术，显而易见。非常显而易见。

original: Weapon? I need none. My spells are my weapons.
string: 武器吗？我不需要。我的法术就是我的武器。

original: Who needs a weapon when you can call down the judgement of Azura upon your foes?
string: 当你可以召唤阿祖拉的审判降临在你的敌人身上时，谁还需要武器呢？

original: Why would I use a weapon when I can summon whatever I need from the realms of Oblivion?
string: 当我可以从混沌境界召唤我所需的一切时，我为什么要使用武器呢？

original: I use this dagger mostly to whittle ice sculptures, though I suppose it'd do in an emergency.
string: 我主要用这把匕首雕刻冰雕，虽然我想它在紧急情况下也能派上用场。

original: Oh, any old dagger I suppose. What really matters are my spells.
string: 哦，随便一把旧匕首吧。真正重要的是我的法术。

original: Do your eyes no longer function? Use them.
string: 你的眼睛失去功能了吗？利用它们。

original: Have you... watched me blast things with fire and storm? It should be obvious.
string: 你看过我如何用火和风暴冲击吗？这应该是显而易见的。

original: I suppose I have this dagger. But stabbing things is so messy.
string: 我有这把匕首。但刺杀东西太令人麻烦了。

original: This dagger is just for emergencies. I use it more for scraping ice off my boots than in a fight.
string: 这把匕首只是为了紧急情况而备。我更多地用它来刮掉我的靴子上的冰，而不是在战斗中使用它。

original: Are you dim? You've seen me tossing around blizzards and ice walls like they're snowballs.
string: 你是傻的吗？难道你没见过我像扔雪球一样投掷冰雹和冰墙吗？

original: The very fabric of reality itself. Or, rather a small part of that fabric. The part that involves flame and tempest.
string: 现实本身的构造。或者说是现实的一小部分。与火焰和风暴有关的部分。

original: Why, the bow of course!
string: 为什么，当然是弓箭！

original: You might notice I carry a particularly large sword.
string: 你可能会注意到我带着一把特别大的剑。

original: You might have noticed I carry a bow. It is not for looks.
string: 你可能注意到我带着一把弓。这不只是摆设。

original: Swords, axes, hammers, anything large and dangerous really. Though I do prefer swords.
string: 剑、斧头、锤子，任何又大又危险的东西。尽管我更喜欢剑。

original: I can hit a small target from one hundred paces away with my bow
string: 我可以用弓从一百步之外击中一个小目标。

original: A sword of course, the bigger the better. I can heft quite a lot.
string: 当然是一把剑，越大越好。我可以举起很多。

original: Twin blades by preference, but I'm accomplished with anything lighter that swings quickly.
string: 双刀为首选，但对于任何轻快挥舞的武器我都游刃有余。

original: I'd much rather use swords than daggers or maces. Take note.
string: 我更喜欢用剑而不是匕首或权杖。记住了。

original: The sword is mostly if I get backed into a corner. I prefer archery.
string: 这把剑大多是备胎。我更喜欢射箭。

original: Two tiny stilletos combined with my expertise in stealth. What? No. Not really. A big sword of course.
string: 两把小剑加上我的潜行技巧。什么？不是真的。当然是一把大剑。

original: Is that a new blade you have there? Is it for me? It had better be.
string: 你手里的是新刀吗？是给我的吗？最好是的。

original: Shields are for those who lack confidence and commitment.
string: 盾牌是为了那些缺乏自信和承诺的人。

original: Assuming I can keep my distance, I pepper my foes with bow and arrow.
string: 假设我能保持距离，我会用弓箭轰击我的敌人。

original: I'd love to get my hands on one of those Akaviri style greatblades.
string: 我很想得到一个那样的阿卡维里风格的巨刀。

original: I like to stay light on my feet, get in close, do some blade work.
string: 我喜欢保持脚轻，近身作战。

original: I'd love to get a matched set of those Akaviri blades, but they're so rare.
string: 我很想拿到那些阿卡维里刀剑的一套，但它们太罕见了。

original: I could use a new bow now that you mention it. Have anything?
string: 你提到了新的弓，我可能会用得上。有什么好货吗？

original: This old thing? Took it from a Nord who bet I couldnt lift it one handed.
string: 这个旧东西？从一个赌我单手举不起它的诺德人那里拿的。

original: The sacred armaments of Mephala. A quiet spell and a cold knife.
string: 梅法拉的神圣武器。一记静谧的咒语和一把锋利的刀。

original: A blade in the back, sight unseen.
string: 背后的刀剑，视线未见。

original: I prefer misdirection and illusion.
string: 我更喜欢迷惑和幻术。

original: Any weapon will do but it must be light enough to wield one handed.
string: 任何武器都可以，但必须轻便到可以单手挥舞。

original: I'm a bit of a hexblade, as you might have supposed.
string: 我有点像一个咒刀，你可能会想到。

original: Blade and spell.
string: 利剑和咒语。

original: What are some things you like?
string: 你喜欢什么东西？

original: When your muscles burn, the sweat stings your eyes, the smell of fresh blood fills your nose, but you're the one standing.
string: 当你的肌肉灼烧，汗水刺痛你的眼睛，鲜血的气味充斥你的鼻子，但你仍是站着的那个人。

original: Yams. I fucking love yams. Mashed yams. Glazed yams. Boiled yams. Yam bread. Yam cutlets. Yam soup ...
string: 山药。我真他妈爱山药。捣碎山药。糖涂山药。煮山药。山药面包。山药排骨。山药汤……

original: I enjoy long ice baths, the colder the better. They make me so refreshed!
string: 我喜欢长时间泡冰浴，越冷越好。让我感到非常清爽！

original: Poetry. What? You're surprised? The Saint Vivec was a legendary warrior-poet you know, though Boethiah isn't known for it.
string: 诗歌。什么？你惊讶吗？圣维塔夫人是一位传奇的战士诗人，尽管波耶西亚并不以此著称。

original: Bantam Guars. They're so plump and juicy. I'm hungry just thinking of them.
string: 班塔姆瓜尔。它们又胖又多汁。光是想到它们我就饿了。

original: There's nothing better then putting on a pretty dress. Well, perhaps the looks I get when I do are nice too.
string: 穿漂亮的裙子没有什么比这更好的了。嗯，也许当我这样做时别人的表情也是很好看的。

original: I enjoy getting up at the break of dawn to practice my swordplay.
string: 我喜欢在黎明时分起床练习剑术。

original: I like getting all worked up during my daily exercises. it's not preparation if you don't work up a good sweat.
string: 我喜欢在日常锻炼时激动起来。如果你不出一身汗，那就不算是准备。

original: Ice. Icicles. Frost. Snow. Blizzards. Winter. I could go on and on.
string: 冰。冰柱。冰霜。雪。暴风雪。冬天。我可以继续说下去。

original: Salmon, chilled eaten raw, with some Sheogorad kelp to go with it.
string: 鲑鱼，冷冻生吃，再配点锡奇拉德海藻。

original: A winter night. The aurora to the North. Red Mountain to the South. A bit of snow in the air.
string: 冬夜。北方的极光。南边的红山。空气中有些雪花。

original: Alone time actually. Now that I think of it, I'd somewhat rather be alone right now.
string: 独处时间。现在我觉得，我宁愿独自在这里。

original: I absolutely adore Skyrim's wolves. So cute. So fluffy. Too bad they bite.
string: 我绝对喜欢天际的狼。如此可爱。如此蓬松。可惜它们咬人。

original: Anywhere without ash. I've had enough ash for ten lifetimes.
string: 任何没有灰烬的地方。我已经经历了十个世代的灰烬。

original: Sunset in the far east, looking over Red Mountain. It is beautiful.
string: 在极东处看着红山的夕阳。很美。

original: Long warm nights when both Masser and Secundas are full.
string: 长暖和的夜晚，其中月球和双水星都是圆满的。

original: A good night of fun with my sisters. Drinking and tasty trifles.
string: 今晚和我的姐妹们一起欢乐。喝酒和享用美味小吃。

original: Spending quiet time with my sisters, reading, playing soft music, and reciting poetry.
string: 与姊妹们一起静静地享受时光，阅读，弹奏轻柔的音乐，诵读诗歌。

original: The rush when I reach into someone's pocket and find their most treasured possessions.
string: 当我伸手进别人口袋里找到他们最珍贵的物品时，那种冲动。

original: Slaughterfish. Horrible creatures, but they do taste delicious.
string: 海中惊魂鱼。可怕的生物，但味道确实可口。

original: A nice eggy soup with some good Necrom spices.
string: 一份用上好的死灵调味料熬制的美味蛋汤。

original: Fire. Just kidding. You expected me to say that!
string: 火。开玩笑的。你期望我这样说吗！

original: Pantaloons. Quite impracticable for a fight, but oh they do swish swish when you walk around!
string: 裤裆。在战斗中不太方便，但走路时发出咝咝声！

original: Some people have a pet rock. But I have a pet skull. Meet Ivar the Bony.
string: 有些人养宠物石头。但我养了一个宠物头骨。认识博尼伊瓦尔。

original: Oddly, I've grown fond of Nordic ballads of late. Songs of the Return #27 is a new favorite.
string: 奇怪的是，我最近开始喜欢纳德尔的民谣。《回归之歌27》是新的最爱。

original: Silk dresses. I just adore the way they brush against my legs.
string: 丝绸裙。我只是喜欢它们刷过我的腿的感觉。

original: If you take thick bread and put butter and salmon on it, there's no better meal.
string: 如果你拿厚面包涂上黄油再加上三文鱼，没有比这更好的餐点了。

original: The jingle of coins in my pocket. A lovely young lass. What comes after.
string: 口袋里的金币叮当作响。一个可爱的年轻姑娘。接下来会怎样。

original: If I said you, would you give me some gold. No? Ah well.
string: 如果我说你，你会给我一些金币吗。不会？唉。

original: Cheese, apples, and honey. They're so good together!
string: 奶酪、苹果和蜂蜜。它们搭配起来真是太好了！

original: Knowledge is power. I grant you none.
string: 知识就是力量。我不会授予你任何。

original: Fine. Just this once. I'm very fond of fresh juniper berries.
string: 好的。就这一次。我非常喜欢新鲜的雪松浆果。

original: Not this conversation.
string: 不要再说这个了。

original: Several hours of meditation. Alone.
string: 数小时的冥想。独自。

original: Peace and quiet.
string: 宁静祥和。

original: Silence.
string: 寂静。

original: Do you have any hobbies?
string: 你有什么爱好吗？

original: I enjoy making little sculptures out of ice. There's a beauty in impermenance.
string: 我喜欢用冰做一些小雕塑。在无常中有一种美。

original: Besides burning things? Oh yes, summoning things that burn things.
string: 除了烧东西？哦是的，召唤能烧东西的东西。

original: I'm a bit of an artiste actually. Ice makes for the most exquisite forms.
string: 我实际上有点艺术家。冰雕塑状最精致。

original: Silk-weaving, actually. Thank you for asking.
string: 实际上是丝绸编织。谢谢你的询问。

original: Give me something to research and I'll read for days.
string: 给我点研究材料，我会读上几天。

original: Have you ever made a dress? Perhaps I can teach you.
string: 你做过裙子吗？也许我可以教你。

original: My sister Drelyra recently convinced me to try her meditation technique.
string: 我妹妹德莉拉最近说服我尝试她的冥想技巧。

original: There's an ancient Velothi meditation technique that I practice. It involves flexibility training and maintaining strenuous poses.
string: 有一种我练习的古老的维洛斯冥想技术。它涉及柔韧性训练和保持艰苦姿势。

original: Sleeping. I'm already tired thinking of it.
string: 睡觉。想想就已经累了。

original: Does journaling count? No? Let me think about this a little more.
string: 日记算不算？不算吗？让我再考虑一下。

original: Do you ever watch something's heartbeat slow as the cold creeps in? Peer into its glassy eyes?
string: 你有没有看过某个东西的心跳随着寒气而放缓？凝视它玻璃般的眼睛？

original: I'm actually a bit of a tailor. Sometimes I have ideas for sleek and beautiful clothes in my mind's eye and I just have to see them created.
string: 其实我有点裁缝的专业。有时我脑海中会有一些漂亮时尚的想法，然后我就要看到它们被实现。

original: Besides languishing in dungeons? Why yes. The acts that send me to said dungeons.
string: 除了在地牢里苦苦挣扎？为什么不呢。那些导致我进入地牢的行为。

original: I've been known to play a game of chance or two.
string: 我以前会玩一两把赌博。

original: I like writing poems about the battles I've seen. We have to leave something for posterity, you know.
string: 我喜欢写关于我见过的战斗的诗歌。你知道，我们必须留下点什么给后人。

original: I've recently taken up knife throwing. Can't kill anyone yet with a tossed knife but it's a neat trick.
string: 最近我开始学习投掷刀。还不能用投掷刀杀人，但这是一个不错的技巧。

original: I must admit to having a bit of a fondness for dicing.
string: 我必须承认我对骰子有点钟爱。

original: Drelyra has convinced me to start up her flexibility exercises. I'm sure I look ridiculous but I must admit its effective.
string: 德莉拉已经说服我开始进行她的柔韧性运动。我确信自己看起来很荒谬，但必须承认这有效果。

original: If there's a pocket in Tamriel, it's just a present waiting to be opened up.
string: 如果泰姆瑞尔有一个窟窿，那只是一个等待被打开的礼物。

original: Does drinking count? If so, drinking. Flin preferably.
string: 喝酒算吗？如果算的话，就喝酒吧。最好是Flin。

original: I'm hoping to get into smithing. Our order's smith died and someone needs to step up.
string: 我希望能学习锻造。我们的铁匠去世了，需要有人接替。

original: Drelyra tried to get me into that flexibility thing she does. No thanks.
string: 德莉拉试图让我加入她那种灵活性的训练。不，谢谢。

original: I've been thinking about getting into winemaking. None of that Jazbay swill. Proper wine.
string: 我一直在考虑要进入酿酒业。不是那种杂交果的废物。正宗的葡萄酒。

original: Ask me again in a year and perhaps I can say smithing is a profession not a hobby.
string: 明年再问我，也许我可以说锻造是一种职业，而不是一种爱好。

original: I've recently taken up poison-crafting. Care to assist by sampling some things?
string: 最近我开始学习制毒术。愿意帮忙尝试一下吗？

original: This may sound a bit droll. But I do enjoy carving designs into my arrows.
string: 这可能听起来有点无聊。但我确实喜欢在箭上雕刻图案。

original: You're looking at her, the competitive eating champion of the Docks District three seasons in a row. 17 whole Bantam Guars.
string: 你在看她，码头区三个赛季连续三年的食量竞技冠军。17只整只班塔姆瓜。

original: Perhaps I can sing you something I've been working on?
string: 也许我可以为你唱一首我一直在创作的歌曲？

original: Why poetry of course! The saucier and bawdier the better!
string: 为何是诗歌呢！越色情和下流越好！

original: I'm making some little metal Dwemer soldiers, but I'm worried they'll vanish. Be a shame to make an army of them and find them gone one day.
string: 我正在制作一些小金属锻矮人士兵，但我担心它们会消失。如果有一天制作出一支军队却发现它们不见了，那会很遗憾。

original: Do you?
string: 你呢？

original: Yes.
string: 是的。

original: I'll take your prattling as simple eagerness, and leave you off my list.
string: 我会把你无病呻吟看作是简单的热情，把你从名单上划去。

original: What is this, social hour?
string: 这是社交时间吗？

original: Taxidermy. I quite enjoy stuffing and displaying s'wits who ask too many annoying questions.
string: 动物标本。我非常喜欢给那些问太多烦人问题的蠢货填充并展示他们。

original: None that you'd care to hear about.
string: 没有你愿意听的。

original: Are you getting tired of all my questions?
string: 你是不是厌倦了我的所有问题？

original: Yes.
string: 是的。

original: Aren't you?
string: 你也是吗？

original: Definitely.
string: 当然。

original: I am indeed.
string: 确实如此。

original: A bit, yes.
string: 有一点，是的。

original: Let me count the ways.
string: 让我数数方式。

original: No let me just stand here and rattle off my life story.
string: 不要让我站在这里胡扯我的一生经历。

original: Pointedly, yes.
string: 明确地，是的。

original: For most the price of annoying me is death. For you and my sisters I make an exception.
string: 对大多数人来说，惹怒我是要付出生命的代价。但对你和我的姐妹们，我会例外处理。

original: This is the first intelligent question you've asked.
string: 这是你问过的第一个明智的问题。

original: Does a kagouti mating call echo for miles?
string: 卡古提的交配呼声会回荡数英里吗？

original: Allow me to ponder. Yes.
string: 让我思考一下。好。

original: No, not really.
string: 不，不是真的。

original: Not as such, I'm just a bit distracted.
string: 不是这样，我只是有点心不在焉。

original: No, why would they?
string: 不，他们为什么要这样做呢？

original: At this moment? No.
string: 此刻吗？不。

original: You are very persistent, but it does not bother me.
string: 你很执着，但我并不介意。

original: Perhaps very slightly. I am quite busy.
string: 也许稍微有点。我很忙。

original: I  prefer action to talking.
string: 我更喜欢行动胜过说话。

original: It's just that I get bored easily.
string: 就是我很容易觉得无聊。

original: Once the Saint Vivec walked for fourty two days. He found a dreugh, switched his gender, fucked it, and walked home. Does this answer your query?
string: 一度，圣人维威克走了四十二天。他遇到了一只水妖，改变了性别，与之混淆，然后回家。这回答你的问题了吗？

original: Boethiah ate an unruly Malacath and all his children, who shat themselves out of her innards, alive. I can endure a few questions.
string: 波耶西亚吃掉了一个不听话的玛拉卡特和他的所有子女，他们从她的肚子里便拉出来了。我能忍受几个问题。

original: I'd offer you a pithy saying from Mephala in response, but they're all secret.
string: 我本想引用麦芙拉的一句话作为回应，但它们都是秘密的。

original: The Lady Azura teaches that a keen mind shows us the correct path, so long as the questions are well directed.
string: 阿祖拉女士教导说，一个敏锐的头脑会向我们展示正确的道路，只要问题被很好地引导。

original: Of course not!
string: 当然不是！

original: Never! I adore your questions.
string: 永不！我喜欢你的问题。

original: Not at all! I'm glad you want to get to know me.
string: 一点也不！我很高兴你想要了解我。

original: Not in the least, but I should think up some questions of my own for you.
string: 一点也不，不过我应该想出一些自己的问题来问你。

original: The attention is well received I assure you.
string: 我向你保证，这份关注是受欢迎的。

original: No. Please keep asking them.
string: 不，继续问他们吧。

original: Tell you what, I'll just start charging a small fee of one gold per question.
string: 告诉你什么，我会开始每个问题收费一枚金币。

original: Questions are like belly-buttons. Everyone has them. You... do have a belly-button right?
string: 问题就像肚脐一样。每个人都有。你……有肚脐吧？

original: I ask myself questions all the time, it's fine.
string: 我经常问自己问题，这没关系。

original: No, but this means I need to come up with more inventive answers.
string: 不，但这意味着我需要想出更有创意的答案。

original: Back when Nindasu was Mother, she'd schedule mandatory questioning sessions. This is nothing.
string: 在妮达苏任校长时，她会安排强制问讯会。这没啥。

original: Your calm, quite congenial questions? No.
string: 你那平静、友好的问题？不。

original: Morrowind has mountains, but none as majestic as Skyrim's. Well, we have the one grand volcano.
string: 晨风有山脉，但没有像天际那样雄伟的山脉。好吧，我们有一个宏伟的活火山。

original: How refreshing it is to have pleasant company on my journeys.
string: 在旅途中有愉快的伙伴真是令人耳目一新。

original: My parents would love to see me today.
string: 我父母会很高兴今天见到我。

original: Do you think we could find a new dress for me? Silk, preferably.
string: 你觉得我们能不能给我找一件新裙子？最好是丝绸的。

original: I need some new shoes, and you're going to buy them for me.
string: 我需要一双新鞋，你要给我买。

original: It's time for a comfortable inn with delicious food and wine. You're paying.
string: 是时候去一家舒适的客栈吃美食和美酒了。你请客。

original: Before all this happened, I rarely left the Monastery. It is nice to be out and about.
string: 在这一切发生之前，我很少离开修道院。出门走走是件好事。

original: Is this what you do all day? Run about to and fro?
string: 这就是你整天都在干的事吗？到处奔走？

original: We should stop for some soup and wine soon. I would love a cheesy tomato soup.
string: 我们应该找点汤和葡萄酒。我想要一碗浓情番茄汤。

original: I hope we don't run into any mudcrabs. Terrible creatures with their beady eyes and pinchy claws.
string: 希望我们不会遇到任何泥蟹。它们有着小粒的眼睛和大力的爪子，是可怕的生物。

original: Where shall we venture next? A deep dark dungeon? An ancient ruin?
string: 我们接下来该冒险去哪？一个深邃黑暗的地牢？一个古老的废墟？

original: You journey with the Hand of Azura. Her wisdom is always with us.
string: 你与阿祖拉之手同行。她的智慧永远与我们同在。

original: I wonder. Do atronachs have a language? They seem to have some sort of base cunning, at the least.
string: 我想知道阿特洛纳克有语言吗？他们似乎至少具有某种基础狡诈。

original: I think I need a hot bath. Let's find a place to unwind.
string: 我觉得我需要洗个热水澡。让我们找个地方放松一下。

original: With every new sight we see, Azura blesses us a bit more.
string: 每当我们看到新的景象，阿祖拉就会再一次保佑我们。

original: Brothers in new strife. Winter's rime freshly minted. Opportunity.
string: 在新困境中团结一致。冬日的霜刻已新鲜铸就。机会。

original: Wind blowing like salt. A bitter harvest in red. The land asunder.
string: 风吹起来像盐。一片红色的苦果。大地分裂。

original: When I call something from Oblivion, do you think it is unhappy to be here?
string: 当我召唤某物来自无间隙时，你认为它会不高兴在这里吗？

original: Do you have a snack? Something with cheese or nuts preferably.
string: 你有零食吗？最好是带奶酪或坚果的。

original: A good guar, now that's a loyal beast.
string: 一只好的瓜尔，那可是一只忠诚的野兽。

original: Perhaps we could stay away from horses? I don't trust them and their bulbous sideways eyes.
string: 也许我们可以远离马？我不信任它们和它们突出的横向眼睛。

original: I'd like to get to Hammerfel and High Rock some day.
string: 我希望有朝一日能前往锤石地和罗克高地。

original: Why does Skyrim get such a bad reputation? It's beautiful.
string: 为什么天际会有这么坏的名声？它是美丽的。

original: Back in Morrowind we never traveled about much.
string: 曾经在晨风我们从未四处游荡过。

original: I do love exploring. What's the most interesting place you've been?
string: 我喜欢探险。你去过最有趣的地方是哪里？

original: I have hardly seen any of Tamriel. It is good to be out exploring.
string: 我几乎没见过泰姆瑞尔的任何地方。出去探险真是太好了。

original: Jagged peaks, starlight. Dark trees in silent repose. Soft blanket afoot.
string: 崎岖的山峰，璀璨的星光。黑暗中静止的树木。脚下柔软的毯子。

original: Blue whistles above. Sudden shifting of branches. Beware, fanged death.
string: 蓝色哨子在上方吹响。树枝突然移开。当心，有毒牙的死亡。

original: I hope you don't mind my poetry. I think up these short verses as we travel.
string: 希望你不介意我的诗。我们一路旅行，我就会酝酿这些短小的诗句。

original: I'm working on a new poem. I'll let you know when I finish thinking it through.
string: 我正在写一首新的诗。我想好了会告诉你的。

original: The rain here gets so cold! We should get inside and warm up.
string: 这里的雨变得如此寒冷！我们应该进去取暖。

original: It's raining again. In Skyrim. As it always does.
string: 又下雨了。在天际。就像经常发生的那样。

original: Surprise, surprise. Rain.
string: 出其不意的是雨。

original: Those clouds don't look good. It'll be a right downpour soon enough.
string: 那些乌云看起来不妙。很快就会倾盆大雨了。

original: At least the rain here doesn't turn the ash to deadly mudslides.
string: 至少这里的雨不会将灰尘变成致命的泥石流。

original: This rain always ruins my hair. Or do you like soggy and wet?
string: 这雨总是毁了我的头发。你喜欢湿漉漉的吗？

original: I know. It's just rain. I shouldn't complain so much.
string: 我知道。只是下雨。我不应该抱怨这么多。

original: Cold I can manage but this dampness seeps into one's bones.
string: 寒冷我可以忍受，但这潮湿渗透到骨头里。

original: A fresh snowfall is one of the most beautiful things. What? You thought I'd hate snow?
string: 新的一场雪是最美丽的事物之一。什么？你以为我会讨厌雪吗？

original: Oh look. Snow. In Skyrim.
string: 哦，看，天空下雪了。

original: Don't worry about me. My magic keeps me warm enough.
string: 别担心我。我的魔法让我足够温暖。

original: I'm nice and toasty, thank you. Bit of Alteration, splash of Destruction. Happy Drelyra.
string: 我很舒适，谢谢。一点变形，一点毁灭。德莉拉很高兴。

original: We should make a snow Aedra! Then ... um... smash it because it's an Aedra.
string: 我们应该制造一个雪埃德拉！然后...嗯...摧毁它，因为它是一个阿德拉。

original: It's so fluffy and white, I just want to dive right into a snowbank!
string: 这么轻盈软白，我简直想要直接扎进雪堆里！

original: Do you think it'll snow all week again? It often does.
string: 你觉得这周一直会下雪吗？通常都是这样。

original: Does the cold bother you at all?
string: 寒冷对你有影响吗？

original: What nice weather. See? It does happen!
string: 天气真好。看吧？这种时候也会有！

original: The chipmunks and squirrels will be out! They're hard to see. Quite small.
string: 松鼠和松鼠会出来！它们难以发现。相当小。

original: It's the perfect time for a journey. Where shall we travel?
string: 现在正是出行的完美时机。我们该去哪里旅行呢？

original: I'd rather not linger inside on a day like this.
string: 我宁愿不在这样的一天里逗留。

original: I wonder, are there mer up in the Firmament gazing down at us?
string: 我在想，究竟有没有精灵在苍穹上空注视着我们？

original: Walks together on a beautiful night, a bit romantic don't you think?
string: 在美丽的夜晚一起散步，有点浪漫，对吧？

original: This is nicer than any night Morrowind has had in the last two hundred years.
string: 这比晨风在过去两百年的任何一个夜晚都要好。

original: I never get to see the stars back home.
string: 我从未在家乡看过星星。

original: Why are you crouching. Should I crouch too?
string: 你为什么蹲着。我也应该蹲下吗？

original: Are we sneaking? I'll do my best.
string: 我们需要潜入吗？我会尽力的。

original: I don't think I'm very good at hiding.
string: 我觉得我不太擅长躲藏。

original: You do realize we're one spell away from my fireballs ruining your entire stealth plan, yes?
string: 难道你没有意识到，只要我再施展一个火球术，你整个隐秘计划就会被毁掉吗？

original: I must warn you, I'm not very quiet.
string: 我必须警告你，我并不是很安静。

original: You do know my Atronachs won't crouch or hide, yes?
string: 你知道我的侍灵不会蹲下或躲藏，对吧？

original: Would you like me to carry some of that junk for you?
string: 你想让我帮你带点那些没用的东西吗？

original: That looks heavy. You should drop something.
string: 看起来很重。你应该丢掉一些东西。

original: A kettle. Fifteen iron ore. Two Dragon bones. Eight smelly piles of rags. That's what you gave me last time you looted too much.
string: 一个水壶。十五块铁矿石。两根龙骨。八堆臭烘烘的破烂。上次你抢得太多给了我这些。

original: It'd be nice to get to a pawnbroker so we could sell off some of that. I know a fellow in Windhelm.
string: 最好找个当铺将其中一些东西卖掉。我在风盔城认识一个人。

original: You look a bit overburdened, ser'a.
string: 你看起来有点负担过重，长官。

original: Contrary to popular belief, repeated carrying and lifting of heavy things will not make you stronger over time.
string: 与普遍看法不同，反复搬运和抬举重物不会让你随着时间变得更强壮。

original: I'm certain there are foes about. Be careful.
string: 我确定周围有敌人。小心。

original: There must be treasure in here somewhere. Or better yet, knowledge.
string: 这里一定有宝藏。或者更好的，是知识。

original: Look for any books we don't have. I'm always seeking to expand our library.
string: 找出我们没有的任何书籍。我一直在努力扩展我们的图书馆。

original: Usually there's a big fancy chest at the end of such a place as this.
string: 通常在这种地方最末端会有一个很华丽的箱子。

original: Be ready for a fight. We are not alone.
string: 做好战斗的准备。我们并不孤单。

original: This isn't my ideal excursion, but it is far from the worst.
string: 这不是我理想的远足，但也远非最糟。

original: Does something smell? Is that you? ... Is it me? ... No. Something else.
string: 有什么味道吗？是你吗？...是我吗？...不是。是其他什么。

original: The sooner we get out of here, the better.
string: 我们越早离开这里越好。

original: So this is how adventurers get so wealthy.
string: 这就是冒险者如此富有的原因。

original: You'd better not have brought me in here to be the distraction.
string: 最好不要把我带进来当做干扰。

original: This is a dangerous place, ser'a.
string: 这是一个危险的地方，小姐。

original: Watch out for flammable oil. My spells will set it off.
string: 小心易燃油。我的法术会引燃它。

original: Poor beasts. This is just their den. Oh well. Flames away!
string: 可怜的野兽。这只是它们的巢穴。哎，烈焰吧！

original: It smells terrible in here.
string: 这里闻起来太可怕了。

original: We should leave. This is a beast lair.
string: 我们应该离开。这是一个野兽巢穴。

original: What do you think? Wolves? Bears? Trolls?
string: 你觉得呢？狼？熊？巨魔？

original: I stepped in something. By Azura that's slimy and disgusting.
string: 我踩到了什么东西。我的阿祖拉，那又黏又恶心。

original: If you linger to do any skinning, I'll go wait outside.
string: 如果你要再剥皮，我就去外面等。

original: We should head to an inn or tavern and get something to eat and drink.
string: 我们应该前往一家客栈或酒馆，吃点东西，喝点东西。

original: It's time for drinks. I hope they have Flin here.
string: 该是喝点酒的时候了。希望这里有费伦。

original: Let's stop and have some drinks at a tavern! You're buying of course.
string: 我们在一家酒馆停下来喝点东西吧！当然是你买单。

original: I wonder what the people do here for their livelihoods.
string: 我想知道这里的人是靠什么谋生的。

original: I need to swing by an inn or public bath to wash the dirt off my hem.
string: 我需要去旅馆或公共浴池洗掉我的裙子上的尘土。

original: I bet they have a stables here. Filled with horses. Disgusting creatures.
string: 我打赌他们在这里有个马厩，养着马，令人恶心的生物。

original: Who's in charge of this town? I wonder if they have any work for us.
string: 谁掌管这个镇？我想知道他们是否有任务可以给我们。

original: If you see a missive board, we should stop to read through it. We might find some jobs.
string: 如果看到一个消息板，我们应该停下来读一读。我们可能会找到一些工作。

original: Don't forget to drop by the apothecary for potions and ingredients.
string: 别忘了去药剂师那里买药水和材料。

original: I like traveling precisely to visit places like this.
string: 我喜欢旅行，特别是去类似这样的地方。

original: Are you tired? I am. Let's find a place to rest and warm up.
string: 你累了吗？我也是。让我们找个地方休息和取暖。

original: Are you hungry? I am. I hope they have decent cheese here.
string: 你饿了吗？我饿了。希望这里有像样的奶酪。

original: Buy me something nice. I'll let you pick it.
string: 给我买点好东西。你来挑选吧。

original: Give me some time, I'm looking through what they have on offer here.
string: 给我点时间，我在看这里提供的东西。

original: That looks nice. Yes that one. No the red one.
string: 那看起来不错。对，那个。不，红色那件。

original: Our Order was once wealthy but now we barely have any coin. Perhaps... you could make a donation?
string: 我们的团体曾经很富有，但现在我们几乎没有什么金币了。也许......你能捐款吗？

original: Oh! We need this. And this. And this. I'll make a list.
string: 哦！我们需要这个。还有这个。这个也需要。我会列个清单的。

original: How much does this cost? Too much?
string: 这要价多少？太贵了吗？

original: Why does every little shit shop have empty baskets on the walls? They're for holding things.
string: 每个小破店的墙上为什么都挂着空篮子？那是用来放东西的。

original: One hundred. One hundred three. One hundred five? Damn, I lost count.
string: 一百。一百零三。一百零五？该死，我数错了。

original: How do you just... know... how much gold you have on you? Where do you keep it all?
string: 你是如何知道身上有多少金子的？你把它们都放在哪里？

original: If I were Vendressa we'd probably already be kicked out of this store.
string: 如果我是温德丽莎，我们可能早就被踢出这家商店了。

original: Do you think my sister will like this? It matches her eyes.
string: 你认为我妹妹会喜欢这个吗？它和她的眼睛搭配。

original: I think their prices are too high. We should shop around some.
string: 我觉得它们的价格太高了。我们应该四处逛逛。

original: It's good to be home.
string: 回家真好。

original: Traveling is pleasant, but I also enjoy spending some time here at home, relaxing.
string: 旅行很愉快，但我也喜欢在家里花些时间放松。

original: Time to unload all these new books I brought back.
string: 是时候把我带回来的所有新书都卸下来了。

original: Did I forget the honey? Damn. I forgot the honey again.
string: 我是不是忘了蜂蜜？该死。我又忘了蜂蜜。

original: Cook us up something tasty! With cheese, or nuts, or honey perhaps.
string: 给我们煮一些美味的东西！可能有奶酪、坚果或蜂蜜。

original: Would you care for a drink? Ardela better not have sucked down all the wine again.
string: 来点酒吗？阿尔黛拉最好不要再喝光所有的葡萄酒了。

original: I think we need more planters. We could put one here, and one there, and one here.
string: 我认为我们需要更多的种植者。我们可以在这里放一个，在那里放一个，在这里再放一个。

original: Would you care to join me in some flexibility exercises? We should have some pillows and small rugs around here somewhere.
string: 你愿意和我一起做一些柔韧性运动吗？我们应该在这附近找一些枕头和小地毯。

original: I'm tired. We've had a long trip.
string: 我累了。我们旅途已久。

original: Perhaps we could gather the sisters for a poetry reading later?
string: 也许我们以后可以请灰纱之女团的姐妹们享受一场诗歌朗诵？

original: Time for a nice hot bath, I think.
string: 是时候洗个热水澡了，我想。

original: Shall we stay here a while? There's no need to go rushing out.
string: 我们在这里待一会儿好吗？没必要急着出去。

original: I was able to buy something useful to add to our library. It's in my pack but you may take it if you need it.
string: 我买到了一些有用的东西，可以增添到我们的图书馆中。它在我的包里，但如果你需要的话可以拿走。

original: I was able to buy something useful to add to our library. It's in my pack but you may take it if you need it.
string: 我买到了一些有用的东西，可以增添到我们的图书馆中。它在我的包里，但如果你需要的话可以拿走。

original: I found something worth adding to our library back home. It'll be much better there than rotting in this dank place.
string: 我发现了一些值得加入我们家里图书馆的东西。在那里会比腐烂在这个潮湿的地方好得多。

original: Until Azura brings our paths together again.
string: 直到阿祖拉再次把我们的道路交织在一起为止。

original: We part, but that is the way of the world.
string: 我们分开，但这是世界的方式。

original: Our paths will converge once more.
string: 我们的道路将再次交汇。

original: There is no sorrow in departure.
string: 离别中没有悲伤。

original: Twilight bless you, ser'a.
string: 黄昏保佑你，ser'a。

original: We come and go, lights at dusk.
string: 我们来了又走，黄昏的灯光。

original: Azura bless us, for our paths meet again.
string: 阿祖拉保佑我们，我们的道路再次相遇。

original: Greetings again, ser'a.
string: 再次问候，ser'a。

original: Shall we resume our journeys?
string: 我们要继续我们的旅程吗？

original: Twilight guide you, ser'a.
string: 黄昏指引你，ser'a。

original: We leave and return, glimmers in the shadow.
string: 我们离开又回来，在阴影中闪烁。

original: There is gladness to our reunion.
string: 我们重逢很高兴。

original: I wonder who this fetcher was.
string: 我想知道这个讨厌的家伙是谁。

original: This one's dead.
string: 这个人已经死了。

original: I wish men and mer did not shit themselves when they die.
string: 我希望人类和精灵死去时不要失禁。

original: Death is the only certainty.
string: 死亡是唯一确定的事情。

original: Shall I burn them and let the Daedra sort them out?
string: 我应该把它们烧掉，让迪德拉 排好。

original: I could end this fight with but one spell.
string: 我可以用一记法术结束这场战斗。

original: My blood runs hot and I am eager to join the fray.
string: 我的血液在翻滚，我渴望加入战斗。

original: Perhaps we should settle this dispute.
string: 也许我们应该解决这个争端。

original: Out of magicka! Taste my blade!
string: 没有魔法了！尝尝我的利刃吧！

original: I'd love a magicka potion. Alas, sharp object time.
string: 我想要一个魔法药水。唉，尖锐物体的时间到了。

original: Step. Thrust. Just like I was taught.
string: 脚步。刺。就像我所学到的那样。

original: This was foolish. I'm too close.
string: 这真是愚蠢。太靠近了。

original: Curse this cumbersome weapon!
string: 诅咒这个笨重的武器！

original: I can barely lift this!
string: 我几乎抬不动这个！

original: Who gave me the big idiot cleaver?
string: 谁给了我这个大傻瓜刀？

original: I feel like a lumberjack with this clobberer.
string: 我觉得像个伐木工人手持着这个重击者。

original: SocManageDrelyraBowT
string: SocManage德莉拉BowT

original: Why in Oblivion do I have a bow?
string: 我为什么要拿弓？

original: Why did you give me this useless stick and string?
string: 你为什么给我这个无用的棍子和绳子？

original: Perhaps if I pluck at the bowstring hard enough it'll do something useful.
string: 也许只要我弹得够用心，弓弦会有用的。

original: Please take this idiotic bow away from me.
string: 请把这个笨拙的弓拿走。

original: Running is but a brief respite, s'wit!
string: 奔跑只是短暂的休息，蠢货！

original: You cannot hide from Azura's gaze!
string: 你无法躲避阿祖拉的凝视！

original: The Reclamations see all!
string: 救赎之神看守一切！

original: There is nowhere you can go the Lady of Twilight cannot see.
string: 没有任何地方可以让暮光夫人看不到。

original: I will catch you, be assured.
string: 我会捉到你，放心。

original: A bit of flame will shorten this pursuit.
string: 一点火焰就能缩短这次追逐。

original: Burn!
string: 燃烧吧！

original: Perish in fire and ash!
string: 在火焰和灰烬中湮灭吧！

original: Oblivion take you!
string: 地狱带走你！

original: Obey me, flames!
string: 服从我，火焰！

original: It will be over soon!
string: 很快就会结束！

original: Die, fetcher!
string: 去死吧，混账！

original: Let the storm come!
string: 让风暴来临吧！

original: Taste my power!
string: 品尝我的力量！

original: Surrender, or die!
string: 投降，否则死！

original: Mercy is for the Aedra!
string: 怜悯是给伊德拉的！

original: Are you all right? Why were those Vigilants after you?
string: 你没事吧？为什么那些监察者跟踪你？

original: They've been chasing me since Morrowind, and finally caught up to me. Thank you stranger, for your assistance.
string: 他们从晨风一直追着我，终于追上我了。谢谢陌生人，感谢你的帮助。

original: Are you Drelyra? I've come to find you. Your sisters sent me.
string: 你是德莉拉吗？我来找你的。你的姐妹们派我来的。

original: Sisters? Thank Azura they're alive, and thank you for helping me with those assailants. Yes, I am Drelyra. Drelyra Uvirith.
string: 姐妹们吗？感谢阿祖拉，她们还活着，感谢你帮助我应对那些袭击者。是的，我是德莉拉。德莉拉·乌维里斯。

original: Do you know where your sisters might be?
string: 你知道你的姐妹们可能在哪吗？

original: I left Ardela back at Labyrinthian. The local Nords rarely venture there. And I was on my way to Fort Kastav to pay for Vendressa's release.
string: 我把阿尔黛拉留在迷城之中。当地的诺德人很少前往那里。我正要去卡斯塔夫要塞支付温德丽莎的赎金。

original: I left Ardela back at Labyrinthian. The local Nords rarely venture there. We already rescued Vendressa from Fort Kastav.
string: 我已经离开阿尔黛拉在迷城了。当地的诺德人很少去那里。我们已经从卡斯塔夫要塞救出了温德丽莎。

original: Vendressa languishes in the dungeon at Fort Kastav. We've already met up with Ardela.
string: 温德丽莎在卡斯塔夫堡的地牢里挣扎。我们已经会见过阿尔黛拉。

original: We've already found everyone I know about. Perhaps you should ask one of the others.
string: 我们已经找到我所知道的所有人了。也许你应该问问其他人。

original: I'm afraid I lost track of most of them. All I know is that Nindasu is back at the Raven Rock Temple.
string: 我很担心我迷路了。我只知道妮达苏回到了乌鸦岩神庙。

original: The only one I knew the location of was Nindasu. Maybe she knows more?
string: 我只知道妮达苏的位置。也许她知道更多？

original: Ruveni is hiding at the Ragged Flagon in Riften hoping for more survivors from our Order. Also heard Drelyra is at Labyrinthian so was headed there.
string: 鲁文妮躲在裂谷城漏壶中，希望能够找到我们团的更多幸存者。还听说德莉拉在迷城中，所以我们正朝那里赶去。

original: I'm glad you found Ruveni. We still need to head to Labyrinthian to find Drelyra.
string: 我很高兴你找到了鲁文妮。我们仍然需要前往迷城找到德莉拉。

original: It seems Ardela was at Labyrinthian. We could still go meet up with Ruveni at the Ragged Flagon in Riften.
string: 看起来阿尔黛拉在迷城。我们还可以去裂谷城的漏壶会合鲁文妮。

original: I'm sorry, I don't know anyone else's location.
string: 抱歉，我不知道其他人的位置。

original: Drelyra's on the road east, probably nearing Dawnstar by now. She's off to release Vendressa from Fort Kastav while I wait here for the others.
string: 德莉拉正在东路上，现在可能已经接近晨星。她正要前往加斯塔夫要塞解救温德丽莎，我将在此等待其他人。

original: I havn't heard back from Drelyra so she's probably still somewhere between Stonehills and Dawnstar.
string: 我还没有从德莉拉那里听到回音，所以她可能仍在石山和晨星之间某处。

original: We still need to get Vendressa out of Fort Kastav's dungeon.
string: 我们仍需将温德丽莎从卡斯塔夫要塞的地牢中救出。

original: That's everyone I know about. Maybe one of the other Sisters knows more?
string: 我知道的就这么多。也许其他姐妹中有人知晓更多？

original: Just got a ransom letter from Fort Kastav about Vendressa. Nindasu's in Raven Rock, probably praying for guidance. I feel so helpless waiting here.
string: 刚从卡斯塔夫要塞收到了关于温德丽莎的赎金信。妮达苏在乌鸦岩，很可能在祈求指引。待在这里等待让我感到如此无助。

original: I'm glad we found Vendressa, but Nindasu is still at Raven Rock, likely at the Temple. She'd be pleased to hear from us.
string: 我很高兴我们找到了温德丽莎，但妮达苏仍然在乌鸦岩，很可能在寺庙里。她会很高兴听到我们的消息。

original: We still need to get to Fort Kastav to rescue Vendressa.
string: 我们仍然需要前往卡斯塔夫要塞解救温德丽莎。

original: That's everyone I have been able to keep track of. Perhaps ask another?
string: 这是我所能掌握的所有人。也许再问问其他人？

original: Ruveni hides with some rogues in Riften. I sent Selvoneth to investigate an old temple, Saering's Watch I believe, in the far north of Solstheim.
string: 鲁文妮和裂谷城的一些流氓躲在一起。我派赛尔沃内斯去调查一座古老的神庙，我相信是在索瑟海姆的最北端的瑟林看台。

original: I sent Selvoneth to investigate an old temple, Saering's Watch I believe, in the far north of Solstheim.
string: 我派赛尔沃内斯调查了一个古老的神殿，我相信是在索瑟海姆的最北部，叫瑟林看台。

original: Ruveni is somewhere in Riften, hiding out with the Thieves Guild. Probably in some dank hole.
string: 鲁文妮在裂谷城某处，躲在小偷行会那里。可能是在某个阴湿的洞穴里。

original: One of the other Sisters should know more. Mephala has not spoken of anyone else's location to me.
string: 其他修女中应该有人了解更多。梅法拉没有告诉我其他任何人的位置。

original: We're gathering what remains of your Order. You should come with us.
string: 我们正在聚集你们公会的残余。你应该跟着我们一起走。

original: Say no more. As the Hand of Azura, it is my duty and honor to help guide us on this path. If we don't leave now, I'll stay here a bit to recuperate.
string: 别多说了。作为阿祖拉之手，帮助我们走上这条道路是我的责任和荣誉。如果我们现在不离开，我会在这里稍作休整。

original: It seems like we've found everyone.What shall we do now?
string: 看起来我们找齐了。现在我们该怎么做？

original: We must retake our home of course! There is no time to waste!
string: 我们当然要夺回家园！现在是没有时间可浪费的！

original: Stop and have a poetry reading of course. Maybe get distracted by two score tasks. No? Oh, I suppose we should go reclaim the Monastery instead.
string: 停下来当然要读一首诗。也许会被两个分数任务分散注意力。不是吗？哦，我想我们应该去夺回修道院了。

original: We should head out immediately to reclaim our home. The element of surprise will be with us.
string: 我们应该立即出发，夺回我们的家园。我们将占据先机。

original: The longer we wait, the more entrenched our foe will be. Now is the time to strike and reclaim the Monastery.
string: 我们拖延越久，敌人就会变得越难以撼动。现在是夺回修道院的时候了。

original: A frontal assault, obviously. We take the fight straight to those fetchers and make them bleed for what they've done.
string: 显然是正面突击。我们直接对付那些家伙，让他们为自己的所作所为付出代价。

original: I wonder perhaps, should we rebuild somewhere else, start anew? No, we should reclaim our home.
string: 也许我们应该在别处重建，重新开始？不，我们应该重新夺回我们的家园。

original: It is time to travel to Bal Meryan and retake it.
string: 是时候去巴尔莫兰了，重新夺回它。

original: Excellent! Let us head out at once!
string: 太棒了！让我们立刻出发！

original: Of course. There will never be a good time, so we might as well get it over with.
string: 当然。永远都不会有合适的时机，所以我们不妨就快点做完。

original: Win or lose, at least we will go forth as Boethiah commands.
string: 无论输赢，至少我们会按照波耶西亚的命令前进。

original: And my bow shall be at your side.
string: 我的弓将随你身边。

original: Let us rush straight at them! Their blood will water the ground and their ash will enrich our fields.
string: 让我们直冲过去！他们的血将浸润大地，他们的灰将滋养我们的土地。

original: Must we? I ... suppose we must.
string: 我们必须吗？我……我想我们必须。

original: An easy victory. What's your name?
string: 轻松的胜利。你叫什么名字？

original: The name's Ardela. Been out here a bit hoping some of my sisters would show up.
string: 我叫阿尔黛拉。已经在这里待了一段时间，希望我的一些姐妹会出现。

original: Sisters? I could help you find them, perhaps.
string: 姊妹们？也许我可以帮你找到她们。

original: I'd certainly welcome it. There are but a few of us left, the survivors of the Order of the Ashen Veil.
string: 我当然会欢迎它。我们这里只剩下几个人了，是灰纱修会的幸存者。

original: Sisters? Good luck in finding them.
string: 姐妹？祝你们好运，找到她们。

original: Thank you. Hopefully some of them turn up soon. I will hold this position.
string: 谢谢。希望他们中的一些人很快出现。我会守住这个位置。

original: Another name for my tally. Maybe your sisters will have loot too. Die!
string: 再添一个名字。也许你的姐妹们也会有战利品。去死吧！

original: I won't go down easily!
string: 我不会轻易倒下！

original: I hope they're in a better spot than you. Yes, I'll help find them.
string: 希望他们的处境比你好。是的，我会帮忙找到他们。

original: This pleases me greatly. I can either stay here for now, or come with you. Your call, but I AM quite deadly with a blade.
string: 这让我非常高兴。我可以留在这里，或者跟着你走。你决定，但是我用刀很致命。

original: Order of the Ashen Veil? That's... Daedra worship. Sorry, I can't.
string: 灰纱修会？那是……拜德拉崇拜。抱歉，我不能。

original: Well, if you change your mind you know where to find me. Appreciate you not sticking a blade in me, at the least.
string: 如果你改变主意，你知道去哪里找我。最起码感谢你没有插刀于我。

original: I hate trolls. Ardela? I was sent to find you.
string: 我讨厌巨魔。阿尔黛拉？我被派去找你了。

original: You fought well! Who sent you, Drelyra? She probably needs more help than I. Vendressa? Is she out of her captivity?
string: 你战斗得很出色！是德莉拉派你来的吗？她可能比我更需要帮助。温德丽莎？她脱离囚禁了吗？

original: It's time to gather the survivors. Not all is lost.
string: 是时候去聚集幸存者了。一切未竭。

original: You have no idea how glad I am to hear this. Mephala is indeed testing us, but we shall come out stronger.
string: 我听到这个消息有多高兴你根本不知道。梅法拉确实在考验我们，但我们会变得更强。

original: If I'm going to bust you out of a cell, I should probably know your name.
string: 如果我要把你从牢房里救出来，我应该知道你叫什么名字。

original: The name's Vendressa. Just... Vendressa for now. I hope the other women from my Order didn't get thrown in a cell too somewhere.
string: 我叫**温德丽莎**。只是......目前是温德丽莎。我希望来自我的团体的其他女人们也没有被关进什么牢里。

original: Vendressa? Let's get you out of this awful place. Your sisters sent me.
string: 温德丽莎？让我们把你带出这个可怕的地方。你的姐妹们派我来的。

original: Praise Mephala. This day just went from horrible to acceptable.
string: 赞美梅法拉。这一天从可怕变得可以接受了。

original: That it did. You'll be glad to know we're gathering what remains of your Order.
string: 确实是这样。你会因为我们正在聚集你们修会的残余而感到高兴。

original: The day has just become better than acceptable. Count me in. If we're not heading out now, I'm going to look around here for treasure for a while.
string: 今天的天气比我预期的还要好。算我一个。如果我们现在不出发，我会在这里四处寻宝一会儿。

original: Which Order is that? Perhaps I could help.
string: 是哪个教派？也许我可以帮忙。

original: Oh, we're a small group. Probably only a hand of us left. We're part of the Tribunal Temple.
string: 哦，我们是一个小团体。我们可能只剩下五六个人了。我们是中庙的一部分。

original: Hopefully they did not. I was just passing through. I wish you luck.
string: 希望他们没有。我只是匆匆路过。祝你好运。

original: Well it was certainly a happy coincidence. May you "just pass through" again.
string: 嗯，这确实是一个愉快的巧合。愿你能再次“只是顺路而已”。

original: Vendressa. Got it. I bet there's a bounty on your head.
string: 温德丽莎。好了。我敢打赌你的头上肯定有赏金。

original: N'chow! Yes there is.
string: N'chow！是的，确实。

original: I like to take up desperate causes. Say no more, I'll help.
string: 我喜欢拿起绝望的事业。别说了，我会帮忙。

original: I can join you now. If you want to meet later I'm sure there's a bit of treasure you missed around this place, so I'll stick around to find it.
string: 我现在可以加入你。如果你想以后见面，我相信这附近一定有一些宝藏被你错过了，所以我会留下来找到它。

original: Small group? Powerful enemies? Seems dangerous. I'll think on it.
string: 小团体？强大的敌人？似乎很危险。我会考虑一下。

original: I don't blame you. If I were you, and you were me, I wouldn't help me either. Or... you wouldn't help you? I wouldn't help you? You know what I mean.
string: 别怪你。如果我是你，而你是我，我也不会帮你。或者... 你会帮你？我不会帮你？你懂我意思的。

original: Fine, I'll just take my assistance elsewhere. Very. Slowly. As you reconsider.
string: 好的，那我就到别处寻求帮助了。慢。慢慢地。你还在考虑的话。

original: Perhaps I was a bit hasty. Drelyra would be so upset with me. I should introduce myself. You may call me Selvoneth.
string: 也许我有些急躁了。德莉拉会对我很不满的。我应该介绍一下自己。你可以叫我赛尔沃内斯。

original: I'm not sure why you came out here. Your sisters wanted me to check up on you.
string: 不知道你为什么要来这里。你的姐妹们想让我来看看你。

original: This temple of course. So Nindasu and I weren't the only survivors. I am... glad they yet live.
string: 当然是这座寺庙。所以妮达苏和我不是唯一的幸存者。我...很高兴他们还活着。

original: The Order of the Ashen Veil convenes once again. Your skill is needed.
string: 灰纱修会再度组织。我们需要你。

original: I shall either join you, or stay here to investigate this temple. Either way, I'll be ready when we make our move.
string: 要么我会跟随你，要么留在这里调查这个神庙。无论哪种方式，当我们采取行动时，我都会准备好。

original: If you need help investigating this temple, I humbly offer my skills.
string: 如果你需要帮助调查这座庙宇，我谨虚心提供我的技能。

original: This temple? What I could really use someone of your skills for is tracking down my missing companions.
string: 这座庙？我真正需要你这样技能的人是帮我找到迷失的同伴。

original: Well met, Selvoneth. See? Civility isn't so hard. Anyways, I'll be off now.
string: 你好，赛尔沃内斯。看到了吧？礼貌其实并不难。无论如何，我要走了。

original: I shan't complain. Goodbye.
string: 我不会抱怨。再见。

original: You're a rude one Selvoneth. And I bet there's a bounty on your pretty head.
string: 你很粗鲁，赛尔沃内斯。而且我敢说你的美丽头上可能有赏金。

original: Talking is a waste of time.
string: 说话是浪费时间。

original: That seems a bit more involved, but I'm interested.
string: 这似乎需要更多的参与，但我有兴趣。

original: We were part of the Order of the Ashen Veil. I'm sure the others are scattered all over.
string: 我们曾是“灰纱修会”的一部分。我敢肯定其他人都四处分散了。

original: That seems a bit more involved than I am interested in at the moment.
string: 眼下似乎比我感兴趣的要复杂一些。

original: No matter. I'll be here sorting through these ruins if you ever change your mind.
string: 没关系。如果你改变主意，我会在这里整理这些废墟。

original: I have a tendency to walk up to strangers and ask probing questions.
string: 我有一种倾向，会走向陌生人，提出尖锐的问题。

original: Oh aren't you a juicy comberry! Well, go ahead then, ask away. This is the first time I've laughed in weeks.
string: 哦，你是一个多汁的科姆贝利！好了，问吧。这是我几周以来第一次笑了。

original: I heard I'd find you down here. Any luck finding others from Bal Meryan, Ruveni?
string: 我听说可以在这里找到你。在巴尔莫兰，鲁文妮找到其他人有什么进展吗？

original: No. It seems like there aren't any other survivors who made it out. Did the other ladies of the Order send you?
string: 不是的。好像没有其他幸存者逃脱出来。是组织中的其他女士派你来的吗？

original: They did, and wish for me to tell you that they're convening soon.
string: 他们已经这么做了，并希望我告诉您，他们很快将召开会议。

original: I'm gladdened to hear that. Shall we head out now, or should I wait here for a bit?
string: 听到这点我很高兴。我们现在出发吗，还是我应该在这里等一会儿？

original: Very well. Why havn't you laughed?
string: 很好。你为什么还不笑？

original: Most of the women I grew up with, consider family, are dead. My home was taken from me. I cry bitter tears each day, but somehow must push on.
string: 我和我的多数同龄女性，那些我当作家庭的人都已经去世了。我的家被夺走了。我每天都在流苦涩的眼泪，但必须要勇敢向前。

original: On second thought, you seem a bit of a mess. Perhaps I shall come back later
string: 想想还是算了，你看起来有点凌乱。也许我过会再来。

original: You'd be a mess too if you were me. I'll be here. Drinking. Waiting.
string: 要是你是我，也会一团糟。我会在这里。喝酒。等待。

original: There's a price on your head. I aim to collect.
string: 你头上有赏金。我打算收走它。

original: Not if I collect your head first!
string: 除非我先收集你的头！

original: That sounds horrible. I'd like to help, if I can.
string: 听起来很可怕。如果可以的话，我很愿意帮忙。

original: It is a substantial burden I carry. Stendarr's Hammer, a self-righteous brute squad of Aedra fanatics, sacked my home and squat there like vultures.
string: 这是我背负的重担。斯坦达尔之锤，一群自以为是的阿德拉狂热者洗劫了我的家园，并像秃鹫一样占据在那里。

original: That sounds horrible. I'm not sure if there's anything I can do about it.
string: 听起来很可怕。我不确定我能做些什么。

original: Probably not. This is my struggle. I don't expect a stranger to carry this burden.
string: 可能不是。这是我的挣扎。我不指望一个陌生人来承担这个负担。

original: Unsurprising to find a priestess of Mephala here. But there's more to you.
string: 看到一位梅法拉女祭司在这里并不奇怪。但你还有别的东西。

original: You are quite perceptive. I'm not from this temple, but rather a monastery in the Velothi Mountains. A former monastery at this point.
string: 你非常敏锐。我不是来自这个寺庙，而是来自于维洛斯山脉的修道院。目前是废弃的修道院。

original: You must be Nindasu. The other ladies of your Order speak well of you.
string: 你一定是妮达苏。你们公会的其他女士们都很赞美你。

original: They. Do? It was under my 'leadership' that we fell to loss and catastrophe. How could they possibly speak well of me?
string: 他们。做？我们在我的“领导”下遭受了损失和灾难。他们怎么可能对我说好话呢？

original: They do, and they wish to rebuild the Order.
string: 他们这样做，并且他们希望重建秩序。

original: I cannot lead again, but I am still the Hand of Mephala. It is my duty to assist, and of course assist I shall.
string: 我不能再次领导，但我仍然是梅法拉的之手。协助他人是我的职责，当然我会的。

original: Perhaps the test is not yet over. I could join you to face the trial together.
string: 也许这项测试还没有结束。我可以加入你一起面对这个考验。

original: You would do that? For a total stranger? The Lady Mephala works in mysterious ways. Perhaps I shall once again hear her voice. I accept.
string: 你会这样做吗？ 为了一个陌生人？ 梅法拉女士以神秘的方式工作。也许我会再次听到她的声音。 我接受。

original: That is indeed a sad story. Let me think on it.
string: 这确实是一个悲伤的故事。让我好好思考一下。

original: Of course, ser'a. I myself have much to think on as well.
string: 当然，在下也有许多事情需要考虑。

original: Oh. You're from there. The LEGAL bounty on your head means none will help you.
string: 哦。你是从那里来的。你头上的法定赏金意味着没有人会帮助你。

original: You are correct. Give me a few moments to prepare my mind and soul for death. ... There. Now you may strike me down.
string: 你说的对。给我几分钟准备好我的心灵和灵魂迎接死亡。...好了。现在你可以击倒我了。

original: Seems like there's more to this story. Why 'former'?
string: 看来这个故事还有更多的内容。为什么要加上“前”的？

original: The Reclamations tested our order by sending a group of fanatics to seize our home. We were found wanting, and scattered across the earthbones.
string: 通过派遣一群狂热者来夺取我们的家庭，救赎者们在试炼我们的团体。我们被发现不够坚定，被分散到世界各地。

original: Former? That's a shame. Good luck with that.
string: 前任？这太遗憾了。祝你好运。

original: You are. ... Odd. But so am I. Good day, ser'a.
string: 你很...古怪。但我也一样。祝你好运，贵夫人。

original: I'm here for your head!
string: 我是为了你的头而来！

original: And I for yours!
string: 我也同样需要你的帮助！

original: I claim this bounty!
string: 我宣称这份赏金是我的！

original: No fetcher, it is I who shall claim you!
string: 不要逃跑，是我要拿走你！

original: You die today, witch.
string: 今天你要死，女巫。

original: So be it. I knew this day would come.
string: 如此便好。我早已预料到这一天会到来。

original: There's a bounty on you and I mean to claim it.
string: 有人悬赏你的头，我打算去领赏。

original: Can I persuade you otherwise? No? Lorkhan's Bones.
string: 我能说服你改变主意吗？不行？洛卡汗的骨。

original: Those Draugr were the least of your problems. I am your death.
string: 那些食尸鬼只是你问题中的一小部分。我就是你的死亡。

original: Die you wordy s'wit!
string: 去死你这个啰嗦的白痴！

original: There's a price on your head. I want it.
string: 你的头上悬着悬赏。我想要。

original: Never!
string: 绝不！

original: I am here for the bounty on the Sisters of the Ashen Veil.
string: 我是为了灰纱姐妹的悬赏而来的。

original: You should speak with the Curate-Militant. He'd be very interested to hear this news.
string: 你应该去找找大研究员。他会对这个消息很感兴趣。

original: You are? How many of those blasted Daedra worshipping heretics did you track down?
string: 你是？你追踪到那些该死的信仰狂热的迪德拉异教徒了吗？

original: As the Watch Captain of this Fort, I am authorized to fulfill this bounty. However, I am certain Curate-Militant Bjorkild would prefer that honor.
string: 作为这座城堡的守卫队长，我有权完成这项悬赏。然而，我相信听政军长比约基尔德更愿意担任此任务。

original: I tracked down six of them, and slew them all.
string: 我追踪了他们六个人，并将他们全部杀死。

original: Six is the correct answer. I'd have sent you back out if you said anything else. That would be all of them that escaped our grasp!
string: 六才是正确的答案。如果你说别的话，我会把你赶回去的。这是所有逃离我们掌握的人了！

original: About that bounty.
string: 关于那份赏金。

original: Say no more! You are a friend to Stendarr's Hammer! Take this gold, and this armor.
string: 不用说了！你是斯坦达尔之锤的朋友！拿这些金币，还有这套装备吧。

original: We also grant you use of the Castellan Chambers here in the stronghold. You'll find them in good repair.
string: 我们也批准你使用堡垒这里的城主之室。你会发现它们修理得很好。

original: It is time for us to part ways.
string: 是时候我们各走各的了。

original: Azura guide you until we meet again.
string: 阿祖拉将你指引直至我们再次相见。

original: Hopefully you return soon.
string: 希望你早日回来。

original: Eternal twilight, ser'a.
string: 永恒的黄昏，ser'a。

original: Our journeys have been pleasant.
string: 我们的旅程很愉快。

original: I need you to do something.
string: 我需要你做点事情。

original: As you wish.
string: 随你便。

original: Of course. What is it?
string: 当然。怎么了？

original: Tell me what you need me to do.
string: 告诉我你需要我做什么。

original: I will try my best.
string: 我会尽力而为。

original: I need your assistance. Follow me.
string: 我需要你的帮助。跟我来。

original: I foresaw you would return. Let us be off.
string: 我预见到你会回来的。我们出发吧。

original: Azura blesses us both.
string: 阿祖拉庇佑我们俩。

original: I am glad to. Where shall we go?
string: 我很乐意。我们去哪里？

original: Gladly. Where you go, I go.
string: 很高兴。你去哪里，我就跟到哪里。

original: I need to trade something with you.
string: 我需要和你交易一些东西。

original: Of course. I am glad to share.
string: 当然。我很乐意分享。

original: What's mine is yours.
string: 我的东西就是你的东西。

original: Take what you need.
string: 取你所需。

original: Have any Magicka potions for me?
string: 有魔法药水给我吗？

original: Wait here.
string: 在这里等着。

original: As you request.
string: 按你的要求。

original: I shall do as you ask.
string: 我会照你说的做。

original: Don't take too long.
string: 不要花太长时间。

original: Are you off to sneak about?
string: 你是去偷偷摸摸吗？

original: Follow me.
string: 跟着我。

original: Let us be off.
string: 让我们出发吧。

original: As you wish.
string: 随你便。

original: Good. I was getting antsy.
string: 好。我有点焦躁了。

original: Back to it then?
string: 那么继续吧？

original: Wait here.
string: 在这里等着。

original: I shall. For now.
string: 我会的。暂时。

original: Don't take too long.
string: 不要花太长时间。

original: It shall be as you command.
string: 就按你的命令来做吧。

original: I despise inaction.
string: 我厌恶不作为。

original: It is time for us to part ways.
string: 是时候我们各走各的了。

original: Understood. I await your return.
string: 明白了。我等待你的回归。

original: So be it. Good hunting.
string: 既然如此。愿你猎取成功。

original: Very well. Boethiah guide your arm.
string: 好吧。波耶西亚指引你的手臂。

original: May your blade be sharp.
string: 愿你的刀锋锐利。

original: I need your assistance. Follow me.
string: 我需要你的帮助。跟我来。

original: Immediately. Off we go.
string: 立即。我们走吧。

original: Boethiah guides our path.
string: 波耶西亚引领着我们的道路。

original: Let there be much blood!
string: 让鲜血流淌！

original: Agreed. Who are we killing?
string: 同意。我们要杀谁？

original: Follow me.
string: 跟着我。

original: Gladly.
string: 很乐意。

original: Off we go.
string: 我们出发吧。

original: I was about to come after you.
string: 我正要去找你。

original: Boethiah loathes inaction.
string: 波耶西亚厌恶无为。

original: I need to trade something with you.
string: 我需要和你交易一些东西。

original: Of course. Trade away.
string: 当然可以。尽情交易吧。

original: You'd better not slip rocks in my pack.
string: 你最好不要在我的背包里塞岩石。

original: Drinks on me if it's health potions.
string: 今晚喝的健康药水我买单。

original: Giving or taking?
string: 给还是拿？

original: I need you to do something.
string: 我需要你做点事情。

original: As you command.
string: 听你指挥。

original: Then it is done.
string: 那就这样吧。

original: Command me.
string: 指挥我。

original: It shall be done.
string: 会的。

original: I need you to do something.
string: 我需要你做点事情。

original: I'll do as you ask.
string: 我会照你说的去做。

original: I can do that.
string: 我可以做到的。

original: Don't want to do that yourself? Well, I don't mind helping.
string: 你不想亲自做吗？好吧，我不介意帮忙。

original: It shall be done.
string: 会的。

original: It is time for us to part ways.
string: 是时候我们各走各的了。

original: Been good traveling with you.
string: 跟你一起旅行很愉快。

original: I hope you find me again.
string: 希望你能再次找到我。

original: So soon? We were having so much fun!
string: 这么快？我们玩得很开心啊！

original: If that's what you prefer.
string: 如果你喜欢的话。

original: I need your assistance. Follow me.
string: 我需要你的帮助。跟我来。

original: Great! Where do you want to go?
string: 太好了！你想去哪里？

original: You won't be disappointed.
string: 你不会失望的。

original: I'll be glad to get out again.
string: 我很高兴再次出去。

original: Following! Lead on!
string: 跟随！领头吧！

original: Follow me.
string: 跟着我。

original: Yes, let's go.
string: 好的，我们走吧。

original: Found a few trinkets while you were gone.
string: 你不在时我找到了一些小饰品。

original: Sure. Where to?
string: 当然。去哪里？

original: Lead on.
string: 请领路。

original: I need to trade something with you.
string: 我需要和你交易一些东西。

original: Don't get too handsy.
string: 别碰得太过分。

original: Take anything. I don't mind.
string: 拿任何东西吧。我无所谓。

original: Help yourself. I like sharing.
string: 请自便。我喜欢分享。

original: Got anything shiny?
string: 有闪亮的东西吗？

original: Wait here.
string: 在这里等着。

original: Waiting. I'll poke around some.
string: 等等，我去四处看看。

original: Take your time.
string: 慢慢来。

original: Right here? Very well.
string: 就在这里吗？好吧。

original: That makes it snack time.
string: 参考时间到了。

original: I need you to do something.
string: 我需要你做点事情。

original: Perhaps. What is it?
string: 也许。是什么事？

original: I shall consider your request.
string: 我会考虑你的请求。

original: I shall do so. This time.
string: 我会的。这一次。

original: If I must.
string: 如果非得的话。

original: It is time for us to part ways.
string: 是时候我们各走各的了。

original: Very well. I have things to do.
string: 好吧。我有事要做。

original: I agree. I shall return to my duties.
string: 同意。我将回归我的职责。

original: Mephala cloak you.
string: 梅法拉庇佑你。

original: Good. Now begone with you.
string: 很好。现在你可以滚了。

original: I need your assistance. Follow me.
string: 我需要你的帮助。跟我来。

original: Can this wait? No? Fine.
string: 这能等一下吗？不能？好吧。

original: As long as it is important.
string: 只要是重要的。

original: You journey with the Hand of Mephala.
string: 你与梅法拉之手同行。

original: I shall grant your request. Let us go.
string: 我会满足你的要求。我们走吧。

original: Follow me.
string: 跟着我。

original: I was about to head back home. Fine.
string: 我正要回家了。好的。

original: Took you long enough.
string: 你花了足够长的时间。

original: Very well. Let us continue on our way.
string: 好吧。我们继续走吧。

original: I wouldn't have waited forever.
string: 我不会无休止地等待的。

original: I need to trade something with you.
string: 我需要和你交易一些东西。

original: It had better not be heavy.
string: 最好别太重。

original: If you insist.
string: 如果你坚持的话。

original: Why? What do you need?
string: 为什么？你需要什么？

original: I could say no but you'd just ask me again.
string: 我可以说不，但你只会再次问我。

original: Wait here.
string: 在这里等着。

original: I am not some thrall to be ordered about. But I shall wait.
string: 我可不是什么奴才，谁都不能命令我。不过我会等着。

original: I will not wait forever.
string: 我不会永远等下去。

original: Wait I shall, but know I am a friend to the shadows.
string: 等待我将会如此，但要知道我是阴影的朋友。

original: I would be more useful at your side.
string: 我会在你身边更有用。

original: I need you to do something.
string: 我需要你做点事情。

original: For you? Gladly.
string: 为你？很乐意。

original: Anything. Within reason.
string: 任何事情。就在合理范围内。

original: Of course! Just tell me what.
string: 当然！告诉我需要什么。

original: Consider it done.
string: 考虑完成。

original: It is time for us to part ways.
string: 是时候我们各走各的了。

original: If we have to.
string: 如果必须的话。

original: I shall miss you. Hurry back.
string: 我会想念你的，快点回来吧。

original: Hopefully not for long. Find me when you need me again.
string: 希望不会很久。需要我的时候再找我。

original: I had a lot of fun!
string: 我玩得很开心！

original: I need your assistance. Follow me.
string: 我需要你的帮助。跟我来。

original: Let's go! But, where are we going?
string: 走吧！但是，我们要去哪里？

original: Happily. I hope we stop for drinks along the way.
string: 很高兴。希望在旅途中停下来喝点酒。

original: Just us or are we bringing others?
string: 就我们两个还是会带其他人一起？

original: It's always a joy to journey with you.
string: 和你一起旅行总是一种快乐。

original: Follow me.
string: 跟着我。

original: Great! Let's go!
string: 很好！我们走吧！

original: Don't mind if I do.
string: 我不介意。。

original: Done with ... whatever it was you were doing?
string: 完成了...你之前在做的事情？

original: I was getting a bit lonely. Let's go.
string: 我有点孤单了。走吧。

original: I need to trade something with you.
string: 我需要和你交易一些东西。

original: For you, anything.
string: 为你，一切。

original: Got a book of poems for me?
string: 给我一本诗集吗？

original: Arrows? I hope it's arrows.
string: 箭矢？希望是箭矢。

original: Of course! Trade away!
string: 当然！尽管交易！

original: Wait here.
string: 在这里等着。

original: I shall keep watch over you from here.
string: 我会在这里守护你。

original: Will do. Don't be too long?
string: 好的。不要太久了？

original: I'll keep a lookout here, then.
string: 我会在这里守望。

original: As you wish. Be safe.
string: 如您所愿。注意安全。

original: I need you to do something.
string: 我需要你做点事情。

original: If I must.
string: 如果非得的话。

original: It had better be important.
string: 这最好是重要的事情。

original: Maybe, depends on what it is.
string: 可能吧，取决于是什么。

original: I'll do it, this time.
string: 这次我会做。

original: It is time for us to part ways.
string: 是时候我们各走各的了。

original: Good. I have important ... things ... to do.
string: 好的。我有重要的事情要做。

original: You go do whatever it is you do without me.
string: 你继续做你自己的事情，不要担心我。

original: Bye.
string: 再见。

original: I needed a break as well.
string: 我也需要休息。

original: I need your assistance. Follow me.
string: 我需要你的帮助。跟我来。

original: Can it wait? No? Very well.
string: 能等一下吗？不能等？好吧。

original: What idiotic place are we tromping off to this time?
string: 这次我们又要去什么愚蠢的地方？

original: I was beginning to think you'd never ask.
string: 我开始以为你永远不会问了。

original: You lead, so the wolves and bears go after you first.
string: 你走在前面，这样狼和熊会先袭击你。

original: Follow me.
string: 跟着我。

original: Make up your mind.
string: 做出你的决定。
